result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex J Biadasz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places: SLZ, KKZ or TRS.

Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
Write a letter of apology to SLZ within first 30 days of probation and forwarded to agent for approval.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Pay costs within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for employment and any counseling involved in with 1/2 on electronic monitoring if approved. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex J Biadasz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alex J Biadasz in court with attorney Paul M. Goetz. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:14 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty files and Amended Information; amended from Felony (Count 1) to Misdemeanor (Count 1 & 2).
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim notification had been given.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Goetz makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement on his behalf.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Impose/Stay a 90 day jail sentence
Probation 18 months
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  SLZ, KKZ or TRS.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Write a letter of apology to SLZ within first 30 days of probation and forwarded to agent for approval.
Pay costs

Count 2:
20 days jail with huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for employment and any counseling involved in with 1/2 on electronic monitoring if approved.
Jail to commence within 60 days 
Go to jail today for start time
Pay costs 
Pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan
20 days to appeal
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Alex J Biadasz in court with attorney Anne J. Renc. David Raymond Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:11 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
No contact with S.L.Z, K.K.Z, T.R.S.

Defendant Alex J Biadasz in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Cousins makes bond recommendations.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Initial appearance on February 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
